isis.stitle: ANTILOCK AIR BRAKE SYSTEM: BENDIX - 3000 - COMPONENT DESCRIPTION/OPERATION - CR - 15 RELAY VALVE/ECU (WITH 4 - CHANNEL SYSTEM 04AZA)

svcprocinfo.para: The CR - 15 Relay Valve/ECU assembly consists of a ECU controller mounted on an AR - 1 antilock relay valve.

svcsubproc.title: Controller (ECU)
svcsubproc.para: The ECU controller houses the electronic control unit that regulates the functions of the antilock system. The ECU performs a system start-up self diagnostic test whenever the vehicle is started and then continues to monitor the antilock system performance during operation of the vehicle. The ECU uses the yellow instrument panel warning light and the warning light relay to communicate system performance to the driver. The ECU also incorporates a diagnostic LED window in the assembly to provide additional system diagnostic information. See TROUBLESHOOTING .

The ECU controller mounts on the antilock relay valve with four capscrews. The ECU is electrically connected through a 12 - pin and 14 - pin connector to the wheel sensors, brake modulators, and the cab antilock wire harness. The antilock relay valve functions as a service brake relay valve and contains no electronics of its own.
The ECU assembly is supplied with electrical power by the vehicle electrical system. Refer to Circuit Diagram for this discussion.

The system's ( Figure 6 ) ignition power source is the battery feed stud. Ignition power feeds on circuit 14C to a 30 amp fuse (F2), through circuit 94A to the crank relay (C424). The crank relay is activated when the key switch is turned to IGN and power flows to the crank relay using circuit 12/12A/12C and a 10 amp fuse E1. The crank relay control coil is grounded through circuit 94-GA. Power is supplied to the ECU through circuit 94A/94L and is delivered to the harness connector through pin J.

When the key switch is turned to START, the crank relay is de - energized as power from the key switch through circuit 12/12A/12C is not present in the START switch position. This avoids the possibility of low voltage that sometimes occurs during engine cranking going to the ECU and causing faulty LED signals.

svcsubproc.title: AR-1 Antilock Relay Valve
svcsubproc.para: The AR - 1 antilock relay valve is a specialized service brake relay valve. The AR - 1 contains no electronic components and functions as a brake relay valve. The AR - 1 is essentially an R - 14 relay valve with a special cover that permits the direct attachment of the ECU controller. When the controller and relay valve are assembled together, the assembly is called a CR - 15 Relay Valve/ECU.

In the antilock brake system, the AR - 1 relay valve ( Figure 7 ) serves as a relay station to speed the application and release of the rear service brakes. Incorporated within the AR - 1 relay valve is a quick release valve next to the service port, which provides for rapid exhausting of control air pressure from above the relay piston.
